meta.name: description
meta.content: Visit Jackson Public Schools (Jackson, MS), an innovative, urban district committed to excellence and providing every student a quality education in partnership with parents and the community.

a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

li.a: Re-Engaging in Education for All to Progress
Michelle Obama Early College High School

div.label: Search Our Site

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h2.a: Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year

span.p: Governor Tate Reeves announced Tuesday, April 14, that Mississippi schools will remain closed for the remainder of the school year in response to the containing the spread of the coronavirus. The District will continue with accommodations for at-home learning as well as its meal programs.

The Learning-At-Home Resources Page includes links to all instructional packets as well as home learning schedules and support office hours. You can go directly to this page by typing this URL in your browser's address bar: www.jackson.k12.ms.us/LearningAtHome.

p.strong: Stay informed: www.jackson.k12.ms.us/CoronavirusResponse | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube

a.title: Go to comments for School Closure Extended Through End of Year

span.p: With schools closures extended through April 17, the District's Office of Teaching & Learning has created a space just for instructional support at home. The Learning-At-Home Resources Page includes links to all instructional packets as well as at home learning schedules and support office hours. You can go directly to this page by typing this URL in your browser's address bar: www.jackson.k12.ms.us/LearningAtHome.

p.strong: Stay informed: www.jackson.k12.ms.us/CoronavirusResponse | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube

a.title: Go to comments for Learning-At-Home Resource

span.p: On Thursday, March 19, Gov. Tate Reeves signed an executive order closing all of the state's public schools until April 17 in response to concerns over coronavirus (COVID-19 ). All JPS schools and offices will remain closed in compliance with the governor's order. The District remains committed to providing at-home supports in terms of continuing instruction and food delivery programs. We invite parents and guardians as well as our faculty and staff to remain connected via our website and social media sites.

p.strong: Stay informed at www.jackson.k12.ms.us/CoronavirusResponse. Follow us on Twitter, like us on Facebook, and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools Closed Through April 17

a.span: JPS Grab-And-Go Breakfast/Lunch and Dinner Feeding Program

div.p: April 17, 2020 – Update: JPS Grab-and-Go Meal Program will serve on Mondays and Wednesdays only. The program will continue during mandated school closures.

a.title: Go to comments for JPS Grab-And-Go Breakfast/Lunch and Dinner Feeding Program

a.span: Mississippi Governor Extends School Closures for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

div.p: April 15, 2020 – School buildings are closed but distance learning continues for JPS scholars.

a.title: Go to comments for Mississippi Governor Extends School Closures for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

img.alt: District Administration Proposes Suspension of Policies

a.span: District Administration Proposes Suspension of Policies

div.p: April 9, 2020 – District Administration presented proposal for suspension of policies Board in response to COVID-19.

a.title: Go to comments for District Administration Proposes Suspension of Policies

a.span: Online Registration for Returning Students Opens April 7, 2020

div.p: April 6, 2020 – JPS opens online registration for returning students on Tuesday, April 7.

a.title: Go to comments for Online Registration for Returning Students Opens April 7, 2020

span.p: Due to the closing of schools, the application window for the Michelle Obama Early College High School will reopen at a later time.

a.title: Go to comments for (Until Further Notice) ECHS Applications Extended

span.p: We have created a Coronavirus Response web section to centralize content related to our current closures.
For more information, view the Coronavirus Web Page Video (MP4).

a.title: Go to comments for (Until Further Notice) Coronavirus Response Page
